definition: an official at a tournament of arms (see arm entry 3 sense 1a) with duties including the making of announcements and the marshaling of combatants
an officer with the status of ambassador acting as official messenger between leaders especially in war
officer of arms, an officer of arms ranking above a pursuivant and below a king of arms
one that conveys news or proclaims : announcer
examples: it was the lark, the herald of the morn

definition: one who actively promotes or advocates : exponent

examples: a gong used to herald the new year
the approach of a cold air mass … is heralded by a shift of the wind

definition: to greet especially with enthusiasm : hail
examples: doctors are heralding a new drug

definition: to signal the approach of : foreshadow
examples: The technology heralded a new age of space exploration.
